Utils Package¶

General purpose functions and classes.

Module Election¶

Election/voting procedure for selection and/or decision making according to multiple sources. Election can be configured in various way, and exported for further elections.

Classes:
Candidate

Represents a possible option in the election and its counts. It mainly carries comparison operators.

Election

Carries election modalities and performs the vote.

Authors

Nathan Ramoly

class ana.utils.Election.Candidate(value, count=0, pcount=0)¶

class Candidate

Represents a possible election options. This class carries comparison operators and its main role is to ease comparison between candidates.

Parameters

  • value (str) – Name/id of the candidate

  • count (int) – Number of vote for this candidate.

  • pcount (int) – Ponderated count.

class ana.utils.Election.Election(path=None, mode=None, default=None, priority=None, resultlvl=None)¶

class Election

Represents the election process for decision making or selection. Several parameters can be adjusted for the election.

Parameters

  • path (str (filepath)) – Path of the serialized election to import. ‘None’ by default.

  • mode (str) – Vote mode; defines the way ballots are counted. - ‘std’ (standard): normal counting - ‘ato’ (at least one): count the default value - ‘pnd’ (ponderated): count with weighted ballots. Without provided weights, the order defines the ponderation. - ‘not’ (nothing but): count by excluding the selected candidate.

  • default (str) – Default value, behavior varies according to the mode: - std:he default value is the selected one in case of equality. - ato: the default value is the one that is counted. - not: values different than the default value are returned. - pnd:the default value is the selected one in case of equality.

  • priority (str) – Priority mode. - ‘first’: asceding importance (first ballots have more weights) - ‘last’: descending importance (last ballots have more weights)

  • resultlvl (str) – Verbosity of the output. - ‘min’ (minimal): returns only the candidate with the most votes and priority. - ‘ele’ (elected): returns all candidates with the most votes (equality) - ‘ful’ (full): returns all candidates in order associated with their respective counts.

counting(ballots, ponderation=None)¶

counting method

Performs the vote and countings.

Parameters

  • ballots (list(any)) – List of elements that are to be counted. Elements should be comparable.

  • ponderation (list(float)) – Associated list of weights. There should be as many weights as there are elements in the ballots list.

Returns

Selected element(s) or list of elements with their count. (depends on the selected ‘resultlvl’)

export(path)¶

export method

Exports election modalities (parameters) into a file. It can be seen as an election template.

Parameters

path (str (filePath)) – Export destination.
